content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very good challenge, the description is very simple. A challenge that everybody would like.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Funny decoding. The part about reversing the message if fun too.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: New thought and finds intresting to solve and engaging problem statement

Goal section
* You may let the player guess what the requirement is in Reverse mode, but please have a clearer description for Fastest and Shortest modes. 

Input section
* Please change "row" to "lines".

* Please change "rows" to "lines".

* Please format [[n]] as a variable.

Thanks.

Input section Done

For the section goal, do you mean something shorter or just another kind of format ?

Thanks !

I mean please write clearly what the rules are. "Your major told you that there is something wrong about ODD and EVEN" is vague.
(1) I don't know what odd and even refer to in the current context.
(2) Even if I can guess they refer to the line numbers, I don't know whether the line numbers are indexed on a 0-based or 1-based basis.
(3) Even if I can guess correctly for (2), I don't know what to do with the hex numbers.

Input section
* You have not formated n. Please do it the same way as you do in Constraints section using the [[variable]] syntax.

* Also, you have missed an "s" after "line" in Input section.

Thanks.

Thank you for your constructive feedback.

I have modified the section as requested for (1) and (2), as well as the definition of variable "n" in input section to make it clearer. I guess the word "Length" should be clear enough now

As for (3), I am not sure if I should specify the use of the ASCII table, as it would remove the actual reflection. But maybe I am being narrow-minded.. Should I mention it ?

Regarding the Input section, my modifications had not been taken into account. I apologize for the wasted time.

It's all right, no worries.

I've read your code and understood what this clash is about now. I'll propose to change the last paragraph in Goal section as follows:

The Floods encode a message by converting each character in it to its ASCII code in <<hexadecimal>>. Then, if the length of the message is <<odd>>, the list of hexadecimals is reversed; otherwise, the list remains unchanged.

Thank you.

I'll update the goal section then comment the solution

Thanks a lot for your feedback !
